books.title: Framley Parsonage
books.author: Anthony Trollope
books.summary: A young vicar with an aristocratic patron foolishly becomes mired in debt.

books.title: Lorna Doone
books.author: R. D. Blackmore
books.summary: A young yeoman farmer falls in love with a beautiful girl who belongs to the outlaw clan which killed his father.

books.title: The Autobiography of Calvin Coolidge
books.author: Calvin Coolidge
books.summary: The thirtieth president of the United States recounts his life story.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: Pollyanna
books.author: Eleanor H. Porter
books.summary: An orphan’s unrelenting optimism sees her through adversity and lifts up her new community.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: Richard III
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Edward IV’s brother, Richard of Gloucester, ascends to the English throne through deadly machinations.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Clark Ashton Smith
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Clark Ashton Smith, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.summary: A woman is hired by the mysterious master of Thornfield Hall as a governess for his young ward.

books.title: The Return
books.author: Walter de la Mare
books.summary: After visiting a graveyard, a man finds his appearance has mysteriously changed.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A famous detective investigates a mysterious and apparently supernatural threat to the heir of a wealthy Dartmoor estate.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: The Rights of Man
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A philosopher and political activist presents a forceful argument in favor of the principles of the French Revolution and of republicanism in general, together with a condemnation of monarchy and hereditary power in general.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper
books.summary: A collection of poems by Frances Ellen Watkins Harper.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: The Coming Race
books.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
books.summary: While exploring a mine, a man falls through a chasm into an underground world populated by a mysterious race.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A collection of Chekhov’s short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.
